intro: Elaeocarpus microdontus, commonly known as the small-toothed elaeocarp, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
